name: Quickbooks Invoice to Google Sheet Automation

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## ğŸ› ï¸ Prerequisites

Before running this workflow, make sure the following are set up:

1. **QuickBooks Webhook Configuration**  
   - Connect the **production URL** of your webhook to the **Intuit Developer Portal** for your specific company.  
   - Ensure **Invoice** events are subscribed and activated (e.g., create, update, delete).

2. **Google Account Integration**  
   - Connect your **Google Client Credentials**.  
   - Enable the following APIs:  
     - ğŸ“„ Google Sheets 
     - ğŸ“‚ Google Drive 

Once these are in place, your workflow will seamlessly capture and log every invoice change in real time. ğŸš€ğŸ“Š

### Step 1: Webhook Trigger Activated! ğŸªğŸ“¢

This node is the **starting point** of the workflow.

It listens for **invoice changes in QuickBooks**

What it does:

- ğŸ“¡ Captures the event in real time from QuickBooks.
- ğŸ“¦ Passes the invoice data into the workflow instantly.
- ğŸ”„ Eliminates the need for manual checks or periodic polling.

### Step 2: Invoice Data Fetcher ğŸ“„ğŸ”

This node uses the **Get an Invoice** operation to pull full details of the invoice from QuickBooks.

Why this step is important:

- âœ… Retrieves complete and up-to-date invoice information.
- ğŸ“Š Captures fields like invoice number, date, customer.
- ğŸ§¾ Ensures the Google Sheet reflects the exact state of the invoice at the moment of the event.

Itâ€™s the step that turns a simple event notification into a fully detailed record. ğŸ“¥âœ¨

### Step 3: JSON Formatter ğŸ› ï¸ğŸ“¦

This **Code** node takes the raw invoice data from QuickBooks and formats it into a clean, structured JSON objectâ€”ready to be appended to Google Sheets.

What it does:

- ğŸ§¹ Extracts only the necessary fields (e.g., id, domain, Customer Name, Due Date).
- ğŸ”„ Converts the data into the correct order and structure for the sheet.
- ğŸ“ Ensures consistent formatting so every row in the sheet stays organized.

### Step 4: Google Sheet AppendğŸ“„â•

This node appends the **formatted invoice data** into your Google Sheet.

Important:  
âœ… Ensure your Google Sheet columns are named exactly as follows:  
- **ID**  
- **Domain**  
- **Customer Name**  
- **Due Date**

What this step does:

- ğŸ“¥ Inserts each invoice as a new row.
- ğŸ“Š Keeps all invoice records neatly organized in one place.
- ğŸ”„ Works in real timeâ€”new or updated invoices appear instantly.
